qas.question: What battle took place on November 30, 1853?
What did the Russian send to Sinop?
While anchored in the port, what did the Russians destroy?

answers.text: a patrol squadron of Ottoman frigates and corvettes

qas.question: What did Battle of Sinop provide for France and the U.K?
When did the Russia disregard the ultimatum to leave the Danubian Principalities?

context: The Russians sent <a1_0>a fleet<a1_0/> to Sinop in northern Anatolia. In the <a0_0>Battle of Sinop<a0_0/> on 30 November 1853 they destroyed <a2_0>a patrol squadron of Ottoman frigates and corvettes<a2_0/> while they were anchored in port. Public opinion in the UK and France was outraged and demanded war. Sinop provided the United Kingdom and France with the casus belli ("<a3_0>cause for war<a3_0/>") for declaring war against Russia. On <a4_0>28 March 1854<a4_0/>, after Russia ignored an Anglo-French ultimatum to withdraw from the Danubian Principalities, the UK and France formally declared war.
